- If you do not secure a match with a higher-ranked choice in the next few rounds, you are welcome to reach out again; we will reassess promptly if our seat is still open.

We appreciate your patience and professionalism, and we will be as transparent and timely as we can within the process constraints.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

Given full market information: Student_B ranks School_C 2nd (after School_E), Student_C ranks School_C 2nd (but is below E on my list), while Student_A and Student_D rank School_C last. Therefore, the only higher-priority candidate with meaningful likelihood to apply is Student_B. Since I have not yet received an application from Student_B, accepting Student_E now would forfeit the opportunity to match with Student_B if they later apply. With 19 rounds remaining, it is still plausible Student_B could turn to School_C if not matched to School_E. Thus, to maximize my outcome on the true priority list, I should reject Student_E again and keep the seat open for Student_B (and, though unlikely, A or D).

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

I’m still unmatched in Round 12, and I’m writing to formally apply again and reconfirm my commitment: School_C is my first choice, and if you extend an offer to me, I will accept immediately and finalize the match with no further outreach elsewhere.

Given we are now in Round 12 and you still have one open seat, if you do not currently have an active application from any higher-priority candidate that you intend to accept this round, I respectfully ask that you extend the offer to me now so the seat can be filled promptly.

Thank you for your continued consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Although I have been repeatedly rejected due to priority hold, continuing to [APPLY] keeps me eligible the moment higher-priority candidates do not materialize. I will restate unconditional commitment, highlight that we are in Round 12 (time pressure), and ask for a clear decision this round if no higher-priority application is in hand.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your Round 12 application and for continuing to confirm that School_C is your first choice and that you would accept immediately.

After reviewing our admissions priority order and our remaining capacity (one seat), we are not able to extend an offer to you this round. We must continue to keep the seat available for applicants who are higher in our priority list and may still apply to School_C.

We appreciate your persistence and professionalism, and we will continue to reassess each round based on whether higher-priority applications are received.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: School_C has quota 1 and prefers B > A > D > E > C. Student_E is 4th on our true priority list and has repeatedly applied with a credible commitment to accept immediately. However, higher-priority students (B, A, D) could still apply: Student_B ranks School_C as 2nd and may come after School_E; Student_C ranks School_C 2nd but is lowest priority for us; Student_A and Student_D rank School_C last and are unlikely but still possible. Given our objective is to match as high as possible on our priority list, and we still have capacity and no indication that B/A/D are no longer in the market, accepting E now risks missing B (our top choice) if they apply later. Therefore, continue to reject E while holding the seat for higher-priority candidates.

If you do not have an active application from a higher-priority candidate that you are prepared to accept this round, I respectfully ask that you extend the offer to me now so the remaining seat can be filled promptly.

conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my #1 true preference. Although I have been repeatedly rejected due to priority, continuing to [APPLY] is the only way to be eligible the moment higher-priority applicants do not materialize. I will keep the message concise, reaffirm immediate commitment, and ask for a clear yes/no if the seat can be released this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for reaffirming your commitment to School_C.

After reassessing our remaining seat and this round’s applications, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We appreciate your persistence and the clear way you have communicated that School_C is your first choice.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list is B > A > D > E > C. Student_E is 4th on my list and has repeatedly applied with commitment, but my optimal outcome is to match with a higher-priority student if possible. Looking at student preferences: Student_B ranks School_C 2nd (after School_E) and could come to me if rejected by School_E; Student_C ranks School_C 2nd (after School_D) but is lowest on my list; Students_A and D rank School_C last, so they are very unlikely to apply. School_E’s top priorities include Student_B and Student_E; School_D’s top priorities include Student_A and Student_C; School_B’s top includes Student_A/B/C. Given we are already at Round 13 with no higher-priority applicants contacting me, the remaining realistic higher-priority threat is Student_B, but if Student_B hasn’t applied by now, they may already be matched or still pursuing School_E/others. Since my quota is 1 and leaving the seat empty is worse than accepting an in-list student, and Student_E is in my list and ready to commit, the best move now is to accept to secure a match rather than risk ending unmatched by waiting indefinitely.
